page.title: 14Minster Lovell Hall.
page.content: Minster Lovell Hall was begun in the 14th Century.The Lovells owned the house and built other parts on later onewhich was the SW Tower.A man was trapped in hidden room.In 1708 some workmen found his skeleton which fell to dust on discovery.It was thought to be the remains of Frances, the 9th and last Baron,who was in hiding after his involvment in the Lambert Simnel Rebellion.In the 17th Centur the Manor was owned by Edward Coke.Gradually the Manor fell to ruin and is now in the care of the Ministry of Works. The Dovecote. The Dovecote is next to the Hall and ca hold 700 doves although there are only 648 nesting boxes.It is round with a pointed top.
